summary: The ancient Olympic Games were athletic competitions held every four years in Olympia, Greece, to honor Zeus. They started around 776 BC and continued until the 4th century AD. Only Greek men could compete, except for women who owned winning chariots. The games included running, wrestling, and other sports. Winners received olive wreaths. The Olympics were also a time for political alliances and religious celebrations. The statue of Zeus at Olympia was famous. The games were never held in different places, unlike the modern Olympics.
title: Ancient Olympic Games
